column4: Beautiful spot for a quick walk or a longer hike. Bring a picnic lunch if you have the time. There is a suspension bridge to take you over to the other side and head down to the right hand side for some beautiful photo opportunities. If you have young children, be prepared to hold their hands or carry them. Steep...

This place makes for a nice picnic and small hike type of day.. there are lots of trails well marked with trail maps so you can't get lost. With the water rushing through the Canyon it makes for a nice place to have a picnic. The suspension bridge is mostly wooden and metal wires and swings nicely. Some people in...
Makes a great outing on a nice day. In the summer walk the many historic trails in and around the canyon. If it is winter you can ski them. Makes for a great short hike or all day adventure.
I really recommend you to see Miles Canyon, the walking before is so beautiful and miles canyon is a really nice view !

The road is closed to vehicle traffic, however, you can walk down to the overlook and bridge going over the Yukon River. Beautiful historic area, where many lost their lives navigating through the canyon towards Dawson where the gold was waiting for them.

Hidden away just minutes from downtown Whitehorse, Miles Canyon offers spectacular views, walking or biking trails, and a wooden suspension bridge over the canyon and the rushing Yukon River. No paved trails here once you leave the parking lot, just the beauty of nature. I recommend stopping at the lookout, as you drive to the canyon, and then a quick...

Miles Canyon is a must see for any visitor to Whitehorse. It's less than a 15 minute drive from downtown Whitehorse, and provides spectacular views from the cliffs overlooking the Yukon River. There are good walking trails, some with historic significance, and great backdrops for photos. The suspension bridge over the river provides a nice view of the river and...

This was the first hike we did on the first day we arrived in the Yukon! What a great site to see - never seen anything like it before! We were amazed to see that nature as beautiful as this exists in our own country.

Visited this location twice in one day. Early in the afternoon went for a hike across the river from the lookout on the ski trails. A little rocky but the views into the canyon were worth it, wow. Then a little after midnight we went back to the lookout for some time with the aurora borealis, freaking amazing! I took...

Unfortunately when we were there, the bridge was under construction but the canyon could still be seen. When you read the history of the area and the canyon, it is amazing what the pioneers and gold rushers went through in their quest.

This was a nice little side trip. The trail along the canyon was beautiful. It was sunny when we were there and the sun made for some spectacular photos. They were working on the bridge when we were there so we were unable to walk across it, but we were there in the off season. Still, it is worth the...
Wonderful small trails and a beautiful bridge, we had a nice time taking pictures with the dog. I suggest 1-2 hours to explore
We drove to Miles Canyon but unfortunately were not able to cross the bridge but the view from the vantage point was just as incredible. Beautiful mountain views and the water and just stunning.
Awesome 10k run from the heart of downtown Whitehorse to the canyon.I had to cab it back as it was -3 and wasn't properly dress up for the weather but it was worth it.

Brought back memories from my early teens when we lived in Whitehorse. There's a decent parking lot now, and it's easy to view the canyon from the bridge (you can now cross to the opposite shore and walk along it for some distance, although the old MV Schwatka no longer plies the waterway.
Enjoy an easy amble along this beautiful stretch of the river. Take the high or low trail.Easy access from parking. A wonderful walk!!

This is a favourite place for our family to walk or to show tourists. If you have little ones, you will need to hold their hands or carry them as you explore. There is a lookout point, which we always go to first. Then we go to the walking path alongside the canyon and go across on a narrow walking...

Everyone visiting the Yukon must see this. The suspension bridge crosses the Yukon River to hiking trails on the other side. The bridge was temporarily closed due to repairs.It is a photographers dream.
Miles Canyon is in Whitehorse, and is a nice place to go for a scenic walk with lots of pretty views and fresh air. There is a suspension bridge that you cross to get from one side to the other.
I landed in Whitehorse. Picked up a rental car and drove to mile canyon. Around 10 minutes drive from the airport. This was a beautiful site. Amazing hiking trails. River and the lake are gorgeous.

This canyon is a must-see when you visit Whitehorse. It is spectacularly beautiful with the turquoise Yukon River running through the canyon. In the summer months, you can take a boat tour through the canyon. There is also a beautiful trail that you can hike that goes along the rim of the canyon.
It's a perfect place to go on a sunny day for views of the canyon and river. The walking trails on the far side (opposite the parking lot) are great for exploring.
Don't get too close to the edge..! Stunning place with lots of trails. However watch the edge. Many of the banks are undercut! Beautiful spot!

Very scenic, full of cultural history, great paddle - with a serious challenge for amateurs! We only really had some experience in kayaks and as a result it was a challenging paddle for us. Beautiful landscapes. Worth it!
An amazing view. The colors change in the tree was stinning with the river running through. Unfortunately the suspension bridge was closed for repair when we were there.
Spent a couple of hours wandering around the area, amazing views and picture opportunities. Made more special by the sunshine!
The scenery is amazing. The power of the Yukon is channeled the the canyon right under your feet. Only 5 minutes from Whitehorse.
Beautiful view from either the look out point or at the bridge itself. You absolutely have to come here if you visit Whitehorse.

We lived in Whitehorse for three years and this was often a place we brought our family and guests who came to visit. You can make it a quick little walk & look or expand it to a nice little hike (longer walk). The terrain is easy and the views beautiful. Being so close to town, this is a great...
One of my favourite places to go hiking. The colour of the water is unbelievably green. Very beautiful spot for a picnic or walk.
Great place to go for a walk/hike. There are numerous trails and amazing views. A walk along the edge/rim to Canyon City is a must.
Definitely worth seeing. There's a lot of history connected to the canyon and it is very interesting.

better at dawn because the sun rises over the mountains. There are walking trails you can go hiking on. It is difficult to get to during winter, if you can get to it at all because the road is seasonal. It would be a fun snowshoe adventure in the winter.

After traveling from Lake Louise through the Rockies and northern BC to the Yukon, Miles Canyon at best is worth a short visit for the pleasant view and a quick photo. It's nice enough and looks like it has some great trails for biking. Just nothing outstanding about it.

My wife's itinerary of things to do in Whitehorse is visiting Miles Canyon. It is a fabulous place to see. The overlook of the river, the mountains, and the suspension bridge is just so nice to see. A plus at night to see the others lights. No obtructions and so quiet. During the day a little drive down you will...
The walk around the canyon is beautiful! So quiet and peaceful!Beautiful site for widowed and exploring!
Great place for walking. You cannot miss it. Take advantage of the Trail that takes around the lake. Beautiful place to walk in the fall.
Nice view and plaques are informative, makes you wonder what it was like to be there when it was first used. How tough it must of been

Miles Canyon is a great park with lots of trails to enjoy. I really enjoy the canyon rim trail that follows the majestic Yukon river throughout the canyon. There are a few amazing photo spots on the rim pathway. Love it!

Drove to it twice...nice view of the canyon and a hanging bridge to walk over the canyon is provided. It is no cost to visit and walk around. There are several hiking trails which we only went a very small way on.

I was so glad I listened to the other reviews on here that told me to go - so now I'm telling you - just go! Only minutes from Whitehorse and though there's lots of photos, they are never as good as in person. So beautiful, the bridge is great, but just to see the canyon and hear the water...

We started our exploration of Miles Canyon at the Suspension Bridge. The hiking trails were wonderful as was the information provided regarding them. It allowed us to select routes that everyone in our party would be able to hike. Plan for a good number of hours, and wear good hiking boots.
This is an interesting walk of an easy nature along the sides of the water. It appears to be popular with locals but you are not crowded.

Great little side trip when in Whitehores. We were there for a canoe trip but made the hike one afternoon before our trip. Hike to town takes a couple hours and trail not that easy to follow, Canyon is beautiful.

We stopped there on a Tour of Carcross City and Southern Lakes with the Touring Company: Who What Where. This site is simply breathtaking. You just won’t be able to keep your jaw open. If you are in Whitehorse, make an excuse to go, it’s about a 6 min drive from Whitehorse. You can bike there as well but there...

Walked just a short way south of the suspension bridge. A beautiful spot for a hike just south of Whitehorse. The suspension bridge is a great photo spot - just remember not to jog across it or it will bounce!
Parking is a bit tight but there are many trails to walk and explore along the canyon. A very scenic location.

Just outside of town so easy to get to. The trails hug the edge so you get great views from both sides. There are also many bike trails from here as well so would be great to do that next time. The road to get to the lower parking lot is a seasonal road, may thru October
We hiked a bit and saw the Yukon river close up. We crossed the suspension bridge over the Yukon easy hike.
OK by sharing up to 100 characters I will run out of things to say shortly. This is really a stupid thing. But you will enjoy the place.

Enjoyed going out of town to see this. Walking on the suspension bridge was very cool, and had we been more prepared, we would have loved to spend some hours there hiking the loop trails. Short drive out of Whitehorse, too.
Beautiful hiking along a scenic gorge cut thru ancient lava flows. The hiking is moderate and trails run along the large lake adjacent to the gorge. You can easily spend a day or two hiking here.

Took a brief detour by this canyon and was astonished – it is surreal and out of this world, with a fascinating history well presented by informational boards. The site has to be seen to be believed. Certainly worth a visit, if only for five minutes. Walking trails looked pleasant, even if some looked precipitously close to the edge! Certainly...
Was taken by tour guide quite a surprise, lovely and gorgeous place not in immediate town. Might have been hard to find on our own, really excellent tour service.

A spectacular natural site that features significantly in Goldrush history. A great suspension bridge that is solid enough for those who may be queasy about heights. There are well maintained trails on the east side of the canyon. There also free guided walks provided by local naturalists.

This is a gorgeous natural wonder. It's hard to imagine it a hundred years ago when the rapids were big and the canyon deeper! It's just spectacular!There are many trails that wander along the sides of the canyon. It's worth following them for a bit because you feel like you are in the wilderness, although you are only 10...

This is just a lovely place to visit. OK, we saw it on a lovely summer day, but it was spectacular.It's hard to imagine all those cold rush guys from 1898 making their way through the rapids which go through the canyon.Pleasant walks around there too.

Drive down to Miles Canyon on Miles Canyon Road and view the amazing scenery. You park in a parking lot and then descend a number of stairs. You are then on the level of the suspension bridge. You can walk along the canyon on either side. You can cross over the suspension bridge and walk for quite a distance on...
Since this really in the city I had no idea how impressive it would be. There's a reason it's #1 to see in Whitehorse.
Miles Canyon is one of my favourite spots in the Whitehorse area. The view is breathtaking, and there are several hiking trails to add to the experience.

We stopped there while we were visiting the Whitehorse area. Few steps away from the parking lot leads you to the canyon and the bridge. Great canyon and great pictures taken. You can go walk more in the trails across the bridge, but as we only had little time, we only made it to the bridge. Still worth the stop!

Beautiful kanyon, surrounded by very nice pine forest. Come in good hiking shoes -- some paths are steep. There are no guardrails, and in some places a wrong step can lead to a fall into raging waters; don't go here if it's raining and paths are slippery. There's a small peninsula jutting into the waters, on which you can sit...
A bit out of the way if you do not have a car, but well worth the visit on a nice day. There are two paths on the far side. Those with vertigo are advised to stay on the upper path.
This is a stunningly beautiful natural phenomenon with good signs and easy access. It would be a lovely hiking location.
Nice to relax and look around, nice views. Good place to see what you should like. Walk around the area or sit and soak it in
It was a nice scenic drive to reach the look out. Below is a suspension bridge and a clear trail for walking.
Beautiful scenery, nice walking trails make this an enjoyable half-day outing just outside Whitehorse. You can even walk from the city centre and save yourself the rental car!
Awesome views of the canyon. Fast moving Yukon river below. There is a bridge that will take you to the other side to hike. There are lots of available loops that you can choose from.

A wonderful experience- a must see for visitors to the Yukon! Absolutely breathtaking scenery! Long weekend in May - leaves just out - a carpet of bright purple flowers on the banks. The water was a blend of green & blue - just gorgeous!!
It's important to know that the drive to Miles Canyon takes a while so that you don't think you've missed it. The suspension bridge is great as are the many trails around.
small hike around place, very peaceful. close to town down a bit of gravel. good way to spend a hour or two. good place for a photo op.

We went hiking through the canyon on a beautiful day with friends. Good trails with plenty of great views. There were free guided walks taking place that day sponsored by the local community. A must for lay hikers to participate in.

When we arrived, the scene took our breath away. Just a beautiful area long the Yukon River. We came in from Hwy 1 and parked at the pedestrian bridge area. Walked along the path on both sides of the canyon. We then went to the overlook along the Miles Canyon Road. Don't miss it while in Whitehorse.
I think we went here the most and I could go back everyday and not get bored. Great hikes, awesome views and wonderful exercise.
We had a nice hike out to the site where the gold rush stampeders camped as they headed downriver. It was a nice hike, not too long or difficult.
My friend and I enjoyed walking the lower Canyon City trail, stopping regularly to photograph this gorgeous canyon. Don't miss it if you're in the Whitehorse area.

Very close to Whitehorse and easily accessible. Imagining the number of boats that went through here in the gold rush was amazing. Be really careful and don't get too close to the edge...the water is really rushing through the narrow canyon. The suspension bridge provides a great and safe look into the canyon.

Met up with the park guides who explained the history and plant life as we hiked. You end up in Canyon City and you will see tip piles of old cans and a lumber rail that was used in the early days transporting goods around the Rapids. Great hike. You might want to visit McBride Museum first as there is...
Always like to come here whenever I come to Whitehorse. The trails are along the canyon, and we've noticed that they've made improvements to the area.

Miles Canyon is very nice. There is limited parking and you have to be extremely careful when it's wet or raining as it is slippery. The suspension bridge is very nice and with the amount of trails it could be a very nice walk or hike. When we were there the people on mountain bikes left their dogs loose. They...
Ask for directions at the visitors centre. You can walk for miles, including heading up to the old canyon city site. Worth a visit, take the lower hike closer to the river for better views

There are plenty of great hiking trails at Miles Canyon and even a suspension bridge. You can explore the area for hours, enjoying the scenery and fresh air. The area is a short drive from Whitehorse and easy to find. Make sure you have comfortable footwear and take care when walking along the rim trails as it's a long way...

The canyon is beautiful both from the lookout and from up close. Recently repaired foot suspension bridge crosses the canyon and leads to a trail system. A short walk along the river leads to the site of Canyon City, a a Gold Rush stop on the river. Helpful maps show the trails.

Miles Canyon is not the most spectacular canyon I have ever seen but it is special because it was a very dangerous milestone for many stampeders who died in its rapids. I walked along the trail and I canoed upriver the canyon. Both were fun experiences but I would not recommend the second unless you are skillful with a canoe...
Before flying out I took a quick trip up to see this. It was worth the stop. Not one other person there. So quiet and peaceful

it has a spectacular view no matter where you look. great hiking trials. the kids enjoy going over the bridge to the other side. you can go walking a long distance, but please well enough to do a long walk. read all things posted as it help you to get to know the history behind in all. beautiful place for...
Kayak or canoe if you have time. A very calm canyon now that a dam has removed the choppiness of the old days.
A beautiful short drive takes you out to Miles canyon - which has become a must see for me in the area. Great spot, with hiking/biking trails, and a scenic gorge. Well worth the visit.
We had a nice half day walk through the canyon as it offers trails for pretty much everyone. The black trails require good shoes but definitely offer the best view!
Great place to relax and enjoy the view, read up on the history before and you will enjoy the canyon and the surrounding area even more.

The views are spectacular and the trail system is just great. Not an outing for energetic children as there are no fences or guardrails to contain them....parents be warned. But the views....breathtaking!!!!!

If your passing through Whitehorse, it doesn't matter for short or for long, as a local I have to say, you have to check out mile canyon. It's right in town about a 10 min drive from the city, and very scenic the whole drive. Drive with caution, the roads are very windy with sharp turns, but once you get...
Very peaceful and beautiful. Awe inspiring. The bridge is very east to maneuver to the other side. This is well worth getting off the beat and path to see.

Participated in a free guided hike to Canyon City. Guides were very knowledgeable. Views were spectacular. Terrain was uneven but not steep. Very worthwhile to gain an understanding of traditional life along the river.

This is a lovely place to visit if you are in Whitehorse. The canyon walls are steep, so if you have young children keep them close to you. There are lots of walking trails and they are well marked and make for an enjoyable stroll.

Miles Canyon S. entrance is about 5 miles South of WhiteHorse proper. This entrance is gravel and not suited for RV’s or trailers. You turn at the signage off the Alaska Highway , drive a short way (1 mile) to a small parking lot. There was 2 outdoor Porta-Johns, and some signage showing you the area. There is a walking...

Make sure you bring your camera and good walking shoes. lots to see and enjoy the river as it flows by. lots of history in this area and enjoyed reading about how this was a major player in the development of the Yukon.

If you are ever in Whitehorse Yukon, Miles Canyon is a must stop. You can walk across a suspension bridge that is above the Yukon river and over the famous Canyon wear Mini of the gold rush miners lost their lives in the rapid boulder filled river. The miners that had come up the chilkoot trail made it to the...

There is a comprehensive set of trails in this area that should appeal to people of all skill levels. We hiked a loop trail long the river that provided excellent viewing opportunities. It was a moderate hike taking about 45 minutes to complete.
Short drive from town. Beautiful views. Great place to go for a walk/hike. Suspension bridges are always fun!

Having spent ten days travelling around Alaska I'm ashamed to say that we were beginning to get a bit bored of the excellent scenery (and certain "rare" animals which we started seeing rather frequently!) by the time we arrived in Whitehorse. However we thoroughly enjoyed walking the trails of Miles Canyon which was somewhat different to anything else we had...

There are many trails to explore. We just went around the canyon for a while, crossed the suspension and went up the canyon a little ways on foot. The Yukon River was a beautiful green color and the walk was easy. We even saw a juvenile eagleflying in the canyon. Nice way to spend some time enjoying nature.

Situated on the Yukon River, @ 6 Km out of Whitehorse, east of the S.S. Klondike Steamship. This short drive is well worth your while! The canyon walls are said to be made of lava rocks of days gone by, where the pioneer Klondike seekers rafted up its perilous rapids on their way up to Dawson City in search for...

A spectacular walk from the parking area off Miles Canyon Road leads to a short hike on this side of the river and a beautiful bridge goes across to more views and LOTS of hiking trails on the other side. Can't wait to paddle the canyon!

This beautiful site made famous by the Klondike Gold Rush is only a few kilometres south of Whitehorse. Sit on the bank and watch the Yukon River race through this basalt canyon at your feet. There is no charge and the walking trails go on forever. Currently the bridge is closed for repairs, but the canyon is accessible from both...

This is a must-see when in Whitehorse. It is unlike anything I had ever seen. An absolutely beautiful place with a fun suspension bridge to cross. And it's free! Be careful if you have children as it is a long way down if they fall!
This place is just simply beautiful. Very convinient to get here, just 15 mins driving from whitehorse. There are many easy trails in the area, walk a few hours!

Safety first. Big boy rules. Stay out of the river. The current is Swift and you could die. No guard rails around the edges no problem don't get to close. With safety addressed. It is a wonderful canyon with blue green water and trails on both sides and a bridge connecting them. The information signs tell you about the land...

This visit has become my cover and profile pics on my facebook page. I hope the weather improves before I leave because, I need some extra time to explore. First time here and I look forward to repeat experiences.
Miles canyon is a spectacular place to visit! The view, rushing water and the silence of nature! A place where you can find inner peace.

This was a really beautiful and relatively accessible place to visit. Lots of opportunities for tragedy, though!! So if you have children HOLD THEIR HAND! I had two (re)teens and I was nervous; had they been younger I would have been terrified. The river and gorge are amazing. The bridge is cool. The eagles were beautiful. The stairs are numerous...

Miles canyon is a perfect place to go for a hike. There are several ways you can plan a short hike through the tranquil trails of Miles Canyon. The beautiful Yukon River fows fast and green, and the iconic bridge is a marvel.
Possible to see the canyon by driving to the look off where this picture was taken. Also hiking trails, I regret I never hiked there.
beautiful scenery,wonderful trails to take your family and friends,great for pictures and picnics,they even have guided tours in the summer always and great information on the area
Nice easy walk here, with gorgeous views. Lots of great spots to take photos. Definitely a must stop in Whitehorse.

Explore a part of the trails, you can reach Chadburn area (lake) and discover some very nice photo opp there. Great for biking around too, on sandy and dirt trails. Part of the old train tracks can still be seen in the woods. Artifacts on the ground. It is a fascinating place.

This is a view that I never tire of visiting. The view point has historical signs which make it come to life. We were privileged to watch a speed boat travel through the canyon and we couldn't help but think of what it would have like to watch a paddle wheeler travel here.

Visiting Miles Canyon and the lookout on the way there is a must do in Whitehorse. Your visit will be enhanced if you first to to the McBride Museum to gain a view of the Canyon prior to the dam being installed as well as a historical perspective on this treacherous waterway during the time of the Klondike Gold Rush....
Just about a half hour drive (if that) from Whitehorse. Breathtaking views and a short and easy walk/hike.

This is a nice place for a walk, not far from downtown Whitehorse. There are some interesting panels explaining the geology and history of the canyon (but I would have liked more as I like those things). The trial is very obvious to find. We liked going to the original townsite as it was a 15-20 min walk each way...

What a great/safe area to hike in Whitehorse. The trails are well marked, paved, and heavily trafficked. There is a big parking lot. There are some camping lots several feet away from part of the trail if you are into tent camping. Much of the trail is not in the woods so you will be visible for safety reasons. Part...
Miles Canyon is a peaceful place with majestic view. The huge and powerful river cross the canyons, but you can be in touch with nature and the beautiful blue of waters! You must go!
Ran this as part of the Yukon River Trail Marathon race what a stunning run and place to visit whether you run or walk. Visit the suspension bridge for sure!

I was lucky enough to have a brother and his family living in Whitehorse for a dozen years, and visited the area in all four seasons. The drive to Alaska is amazing, the sledding/quadding is excellent, and you absolutely must plan to do the Chilkoot Trail if you are able - it should be on everyone's bucket list. But a...
Only a few kilometres from downtown Whitehorse, this is a MUST see. There are walking trails on along the Yukon River that go for several miles.

Arrived late in the day and late in the season....so didn't get to really feel it out. However, during my brief visit I could really feel the history of this place! Scenery was spectacular! A 'must do' while visiting the Whitehorse area.
Easily accessible by car or bike, Miles Canyon is beautiful spot to spend hiking for a few minutes or a few hours.

Beautiful area for a hike. Sadly the paddle wheeler no longer runs- it used to travel along the river and give a wonderful monologue about the area and what you were seeing. The water is not safe for small craft due to the force and eddies.
When you stand there looking at how rough the current was, you can imagine what it was like during the gold rush when many boats sunk while travelling through this area to reach Dawson City.
Great find shared with us by a local resident. The suspension bridge had a beautiful view of the canyon and was a wonderful spot for photos. All just a 10 minute drive from town.

This is a very beautiful spot to visit and there are trails to wander along. The one thing I will say is if you have small children you must be very careful with them. This area has no fencing and the river here is very swift with undertow. If children get to close to the edge they could fall in....

If you like hiking, and don't mid drop offs, or scrambling up slopes, this is the place for you. You may hike as long as you like, and visit sites along the gold rush. If you are lucky enough to be with locals, you can learn about the trail and boat races that pass through that area.
an excellent hike location close to Whitehorse, exceptional scenery, easy access, stairs, suspension bridge over canyon, offers exceptional views, historic placards are very useful and informative

Spent a couple hours at the site, very close to Whitehorse. Just past the float plane area, there is a suspension bridge that leads to several hiking trails, we took upper canyon trail which follows the river, then we turned around and took part of lower canyon path on our way back. Nice break from the city with rolling Rapids...

This is an amazing piece of history for the Klondike Gold Rush, but also a great hike. There are many hikes you can go on, we took an hour hike around the canyon. The rock formations are fantastic to look at and you get some really great views throughout the hikes!
Beautiful, scenic trails along the Yukon River and Canyon. Especially beautiful in September when the Fall colors are abundant.

We loved this natural attraction in Whitehorse. Just 20 mins from the town this place is beautiful. The Lower Canyon Walk is about 1.75 kms and takes about 2 hrs of leisurely walk with beautiful views , thundering river and calmness thereafter, loads of flora and fauna on the way. This walk will also take you to Canyon City a...

Outside of town so it takes about 90 minutes to walk. The weather was perfect so it made the trip well worth it. We tried to rent bicycles but we couldn't get them back in time since the town closes down early even though in the summer time (hence the tourist season) the day light stays quite late.
Great photo spot on a nice day. Also good for picnics. Try to get there when tour buses are not present.
This is a must see when visiting Whitehorse. There are trails, a foot bridge and interpretive signs. Stick to the high path if you get queasy with heights and flowing water!

We ended out August vacation at this spot. Had the weather been a little warmer and drier, and we had more time, it looks to be a great spot for hiking. History of the place is shared on information boards and rounded out our knowledge of the gold rush and the challenges the stampeders faced.
We visited in early September in the evening. It was still a beautiful place to visit in the late day light. Warning - the road to the canyon full of potholes so drive slowly.

As a Southeast Alaskan, I am blessed to live everyday in a beautiful place, yet Miles Canyon was exceptionally stunning. We traveled during the Labor Day weekend, and the fall colors along with this beautiful river canyon was world class beautiful.

We only stopped here to see the suspension bridge, which was a sight to see, with the uniquely green shaded water. A beautiful peaceful canyon, this is a must see in this area, if you are passing by. Nice visitors center with snacks, rest rooms and gift shop.

When visiting Whitehorse, be sure to stop at Miles Canyon. It is not only beautiful, it affords some excellent hiking trails that are sure to please. When we visited, there were even some guides who would assist if so desired. They were also hosting local artisans of the area that weekend - painting, music, etc. This beautiful area has an...
Didn't need to change the name. The natives got it right the first time..Colonials don;t need to rename everything..How about a little dignity for them who got there first?
Just on the outskirts of the city. A nice easy hike. Great views with turquoise water, a pretty foot bridge. Bring your camera.

Visited this place with my grown children and I was amazed at how peaceful it was. Many folks had their dogs and were hiking along the many trails that surround this attraction. I wish everyone could see it at least once.
Awesome views and great walkway across. The Yukon River has cut a deep gorge. There are no fences or barriers to ruin the view.

Fabulous views, well-marked trails. The RIm Trail takes you right along the edge of the canyon. Not recommended for anyone with a fear of heights. If this is you, take the other trail, a bit inland, but still amazing views.

This is a great walking area within minutes of Whitehorse. We walked the flat area ourselves then joined a free tour up to the Canyon City just upstream from the suspended bridge. The scenery was great and if you can get one of the free tours during the summer put on by the conservation group do it, all kinds of...
Stumbled on this on drive back to RV park..Absolutely amazing photo ops and trails .Wish we'd had more time..
Really happy we stopped here. You can walk 10 minutes or hours if you want. Not only beautiful nature but also gold rush memories.
The history attached to this beautiful spot is integral to keeping the Yukon past and present alive.There is nothing else in Canada that can match this stunning site and view.

A bunch of ladies from Skagway went up to eat at the restaurant and had a great time. I had a pastrami sandwich which was great, my friends had the Buffalo burger and home made fries. All great, they are open for lunch 10-3 or so Monday through Saturday. The chef is really great, she is internationally renown! Will get...

Whitehorse has to be one of the prettiest places in Canada. Make sure you explore all the different options and valleys to see and experience. It's easy to get 'postcard' photos as the views are spectacular!

For tourists interested in history of Yukon it is good to see Miles Canyon. On way go through south access route around Schwatka lake not by Alaska Hihway. Reason- it allows one to see the lake and the dam which provide power to city and Yukon but also backed up the river and made Miles Canyon passible. Better view from...
What a wonderful spot to take in the view and set the scene for the next three weeks of our tour. There is a history board there to give you the history of the canyon.

Very beautiful worth checking out when in Whitehorse Yukon. Paddling was amazing and was the walking over the bridge. History is in the air, you feel it as you walk the same steps as the gold miners did in gold rush era.

Great scenery with some excellent walking trails. In laws did the MV Schwatka tour up the river and thoroughly enjoyed it.
This place is beautiful, full of history and great for hiking trails. Stop by for a picnic, a long hike or just for a quick walk over the bridge.

lovely, suspension bridge, easy trails and beautiful scenery
